p: Donor/recipient CMV serostatus is an important determinant of the risk of CMV infection after allogeneic HSCT. Leaving apart D –/R – recipients, the risk increases steeply from D +/R – to D +/R +, with the highest risk for D –/R + transplantations [ 7]. The study by Zhao et al was limited to concordant seropositive donor/recipient pairs, thus a high-risk group.
